title: Update extension input to support error
body:
### User Story

As a developer, I want to have the ability to show that an input value is incorrect. Add an `error` property that when provided is displayed inline.

Design: 
* https://www.figma.com/file/cb4p8AxLtTF3q1L6JYDnKN15/Index?node-id=858%3A64
* https://www.figma.com/file/cb4p8AxLtTF3q1L6JYDnKN15/Index?node-id=858%3A144

`error` would be an extra property added to the extension input component. It could reuse what has been done for the regular input component.

### Description

*Type*: Feature

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 80.0 DAI (80.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $43,768.14 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)
Hey @jeluard, the `error` property should be for the react native front-end, right?

`error` would be an extra property added to the extension [input](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/develop/src/status_im/extensions/core.cljs#L319) component. It could reuse what has been done for the regular [input component](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/develop/src/status_im/ui/components/text_input/view.cljs#L26).

Hey @jeluard, I'm getting this `Error: File not found: index.android.js in any of the project roots` while building. I found an issue on this in the repository that was closed without any resolution. Please help or let me know if I should raise an issue.
@mukulverm4 Looks like you are missing some `react-native` process running? Make sure you follow our docs and don't get any unexpected error message.

I tried again and got the following while make setup in Ubuntu
```
Task :react-native-android:androidJavadoc 
/home/hotfudge/Projects/status-react/node_modules/react-native/ReactAndroid/src/main/java/com/facebook/react/bridge/ModuleSpec.java:10: error: package com.facebook.react.common.build does not exist
import com.facebook.react.common.build.ReactBuildConfig;
                                      ^
/home/hotfudge/Projects/status-react/node_modules/react-native/ReactAndroid/src/main/java/com/facebook/react/uimanager/UIViewOperationQueue.java:11: error: package com.facebook.common.logging does not exist
import com.facebook.common.logging.FLog;
                                  ^
...

100 warnings
```
@mukulverm4 Never seen this one. There might be some other errors before this one?
No, no error before this.

@jeluard I am still unable to build status in Ubuntu and I found out this same [issue](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/5636). Can you confirm that it builds on Ubuntu?

Also, is there any way to build on Windows?
@mukulverm4 Yes I am using ubuntu myself. Not sure about windows.

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. **Started** 3. Submitted 4. Done 

<hr>

@mukulverm4 due to inactivity, we have escalated [this issue](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020) to Gitcoin's moderation team. Let us know if you believe this has been done in error!

* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [x] escalation to mods (6 days)

Funders only: Snooze warnings for [1 day](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020?snooze=1) | [3 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020?snooze=3) | [5 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020?snooze=5) | [10 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020?snooze=10) | [100 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7104/2020?snooze=100)
Hey @jeluard, even after many attempts I haven't been able to setup the environment. I am gonna stop working on this now. I am sorry to have wasted your time.

@mukulverm4 This has been far from a waste of time, we're glad to hear your feedback and we are aware of the difficulty some users find setting up our build setup. The good news is there is a great amount of work going on towards making the build process simpler for newcomer developers. Would love it if we could nail down what the problem was and hopefully allow and encourage you to contribute.

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. **Cancelled**
__The funding of 80.0 DAI (80.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to this issue has been **cancelled** by the bounty submitter__ * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $51,626.08 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)
As agreed with @jeluard on #7105 , I will work on this ✋

Do you have `react-native start` running in a separate terminal?

So @jeluard , this should be enough to run a app without issues?
@alexanmtz As long as you follow the steps in the docs you should be good yes.
Yeah @jeluard , I followed all the steps and still having this error on node. I will try to figure out why this is happening.
@alexanmtz Did you try with recent develop? It should be simpler now
Hello @jeluard , I was stuck on this, I will try again today about the progress
@jeluard is this no longer a bounty?  It was cancelled previously.  I'd like to remove it from the board if so.

Feel free to remove it.

Hello @jeluard , I could run the project successfully 🚀 😄 

I have the following screen with an input which triggers an error as described here:
![screen-changed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88840/56354970-6875f500-61d5-11e9-8854-9301fc4d5c4e.png)

So this issue is solved and now we need to extend the input to support numerical range in #7105 ?

Great news!

But no it’s not fixed. The issue is about implementing this in extensions.
You have more details in the original issue.

I see @jeluard , I'm working on it.

Hello @jeluard , I'm having a great progress on this issue and this is a really cool project. I'm still newbie on closure.js, but I can see how the architecture works.

After I changed the code locally and I added the `error` property, I would like to test, and I created an extension like this:

```
{meta {:name          "Test extension example"
       :description   "just to test the input error example"
       :documentation ""}

 views/hello
 [input {:style {:margin 10} :placeholder "Test" :error "test error"}]
 
 hooks/wallet.settings.hello
 {:label   "Test wallet settings"
  :view    [hello]}}
```

And locally I activated this extension and I'm not sure if my changes is reflecting on the extension to trigger the error locally. So this is the right way to test my changes locally? I can count with the package manager and update on the app, or I need to rebuild in this case? 

Thanks!
Sounds like you are doing everything right! If you have the whole status dev flow setup, you should be good.
